headline: Southwest (LUV) Q1 Earnings: Taking a Look at Key Metrics Versus Estimates
summary: While the top- and bottom-line numbers for Southwest (LUV) give a sense of how the business performed in the quarter ended March 2025, it could be worth looking at how some of its key metrics compare to Wall Street estimates and year-ago values.

headline: Southwest Airlines (LUV) Reports Q1 Loss, Tops Revenue Estimates
summary: Southwest (LUV) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of 27.78% and 0.40%, respectively, for the quarter ended March 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Southwest Airlines Drops Forecast as Leisure Travelers Pull Back
summary: A pullback in travel demand is hurting Southwest Airlines, and the airline pulled its full-year business projections given overall economic uncertainty.

raw.headline: Southwest Airlines Drops Forecast as Leisure Travelers Pull Back
raw.summary: A pullback in travel demand is hurting Southwest Airlines, and the airline pulled its full-year business projections given overall economic uncertainty.

headline: Southwest Airlines drops forecast as US trade war shakes industry
summary: CHICAGO (Reuters) -Southwest Airlines became the latest U.S. carrier on Wednesday to withdraw its financial forecast as President Donald Trump's trade war has created the biggest uncertainty for the industry since the COVID-19 pandemic.  With the trade war raising the prospect of slower economic growth and higher inflation, both tourists and corporations are sitting tight, leading to a pullback in travel spending.  Southwest said it is not able to reaffirm its previous forecast of $1.7 billion in earnings before interest and taxes in 2025 and about $3.8 billion in 2026.

raw.headline: Southwest Airlines drops forecast as US trade war shakes industry

With the trade war raising the prospect of slower economic growth and higher inflation, both tourists and corporations are sitting tight, leading to a pullback in travel spending.  Southwest said it is not able to reaffirm its previous forecast of $1.7 billion in earnings before interest and taxes in 2025 and about $3.8 billion in 2026.

headline: Southwest: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: DALLAS (AP) — Southwest Airlines Co. (LUV) on Wednesday reported a loss of $149 million in its first quarter. The Dallas-based company said it had a loss of 26 cents per share. Losses, adjusted for non-recurring costs, came to 13 cents per share.

headline: Why Airline Stocks Are Flying High Today
summary: Shares of JetBlue Airways (NASDAQ: JBLU) traded up 10% as of 10 a.m. ET, and shares of United Airlines Holdings (NASDAQ: UAL), Delta Air Lines (NYSE: DAL), American Airlines Group (NASDAQ: AAL), and Southwest Airlines (NYSE: LUV) were all up more than 5%.  Historically, airlines have been a bad sector to invest in during a recession.
